taskDefinition.name: Nagios XI Create Service
taskDefinition.author: support@kineticdata.com
taskDefinition.description: This handler creates a new Nagios XI service object.

parameter.label: error handling
parameter.tooltip: Determine what to return if an error is encountered.

parameter.label: return response
parameter.tooltip: true or false. Determines if Kinetic Task returns the Nagios response output.

parameter.label: host name
parameter.tooltip: Host name to apply to the new host.

parameter.label: service description
parameter.tooltip: Service description for the new service

parameter.label: check command
parameter.tooltip: The command to run with command parameters. Example: check_ping\!3000,80%\!5000,100%

parameter.label: max check attempts
parameter.tooltip: Max number of attempts to try adding the host.

parameter.label: check interval
parameter.tooltip: Time in minutes for how often the service checks.

parameter.label: check period
parameter.tooltip: Time period name for when checks take place for this host.

parameter.label: retry interval
parameter.tooltip: Time in minutes for how often the service is checked after a failed check.

parameter.label: contacts
parameter.tooltip: Nagios usernames to notify for alerts with this host. Comma seperated. Use this parameter *or* the contact groups parameter.

parameter.label: contact groups
parameter.tooltip: Nagios group names to notify for alerts with this host. Comma seperated. Use this parameter *or* the contacts parameter.

parameter.label: notification interval
parameter.tooltip: Interval check period in minutes for alert notifications on this host.

parameter.label: notification period
parameter.tooltip: Notification time period name. Determines the time period that notifications take place in.

parameter.label: apply config
parameter.tooltip: 1 or 0 for true or false. 1 will restart the Nagios Core service and apply the change.
